intro: Distictella granulosa, commonly known as the granulated distictella, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine, granular texture, giving it its common name. Distictella granulosa is often found in coastal and semi-arid environments, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
